intro: Lachenalia whitehillensis, commonly known as the Whitehill's lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms during the cooler months of the year. Lachenalia whitehillensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in succulent gardens.
